text: JOHN KASICH: Well I don't

And unless it gets fixes, I
would-- look, I'm against it.

And I'm not against
it just because I
want to be against it.

There's some things
in these bills,

in these provisions,
that are an improvement.

My job, as I see my job
as a governor of a state,

not as a Republican governor,
but the governor of this state,

my job is to look,
not just today,

but in the out
years, at the impact

it's going to have on
people who need help.
Can they improve this bill?

Yeah, I think they
could improve it.
I hope they do.

- So if there is no
improvement, just to be clear,
you are encouraging--
you're a senator.
JOHN KASICH: [inaudible]
- I mean, you're asking--

you're asking-- you're
encouraging Republicans

to vote against this unless
it's improved in the ways
that you just laid out.

JOHN KASICH: No,
what I'm encouraging

them to do-- what I'm going
encouraging them to do
is to fix it.
